subject: Critical Thinking
title: Thinking Like a Fact-Checker: Everyday Habits
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Thinking Like a Fact-Checker: Everyday Habits.

hook.text: You don't need a journalism degree to check facts.

buildup.text: Habit 1: Check the source before reading the content. Who published this? What's their track record?

discovery.text: Habit 2: Read past the headline. Habit 3: Check the date. Old stories recirculate as if new during crises.

climax.text: Habit 5: Emotional check. If a story makes you furious, it was designed to. That's your cue to verify, not share.

punchline.text: Five habits. Five seconds each. A lifetime of better information.

quiz.question: Why should you check the date on a news story?
options: Old stories recirculate during crises and are presented as new
